channel.title: Data Structures on vibhor kanojia
channel.description: Recent content in Data Structures on vibhor kanojia

item.title: Binary Tree
item.description: Unlike Arrays, Linked Lists, Stacks and Queues, which are linear data structures, trees are hierarchical data structures. Many real world datasets are hierarchical by nature and it makes more sense to store them in a tree data structure. I'll be discussing a special type of trees, Binary Trees.

item.title: Array
item.description:
In C++, arrays can be used to store a collection of elements having the same type, where each element is uniquely identified by an index. Elements in an array are stored consecutively, and hence, given the address of the first element, the address of each element can be calculated using a mathematical formula. This provides O(1) access to each element of the array.

The size of an array means the number of elements it can hold.
